data.title: Hit our needs
data.text: We wanted a hearty brunch/lunch breakfast loy kind of thingee....we got two diverse orders and both of us were thrilled with our dishes. The blend of tastes and textures was amazing yet nothing was over the top. Good solid comfort food. Nice setting in a cool shared market . Will definitely recommend based on our very solid first experience just yesterday lunch.

data.title: Scrumptious breakfast
data.text: Tres Mil is in the 5th St building south east on the second floor. Loved the eggs verde served on a masa tortilla (thickness was more like a huarache). We went early so Tres Mil was the only restaurant in the food court open. Nice and bright shared seating area with high ceilings and rope/pulleys fans. They have tables and an elevated area if the weather is nice and an open central courtyard if it's a bit windy. Looking forward to trying non-breakfast items.

data.title: Good breakfast spot
data.text: Located in downtown Eugene this is a good place to stop for breakfast. There's ample parking in the area. It has a Mexican theme.  The chili cornbread and eggs were excellent.  The garden for frittata was also wonderful.  Prices were reasonable and the service was good.  Space his shared in common food court.

data.title: Succulent tacos!
data.text: Yes, Tacovore and Belly have delicious tacos. But… the carnitas verdes taco at Tres is in a class of its own. Moist, tender, and deeply flavored (and lots of it!) pork sandwiched between two fresh corn soft tacos: heaven. The salsas also are delicious, as are the guacamole, rice, and beans. Yes, there is only one meat option taco--- but it's the city's best!

data.title: Spicy but flavourful!
data.text: I just had lunch at Josh Welton's restaurant, Tres Mil Border Cafe in 5th St Market. It was amazing. The front people were attentive and helpful and the food was great. I asked how hot the chiles were in the carnitas tacos because I was in the mood for tomatillo salsa. The server told me that they were pretty hot, but very tasty. So I decided to risk my palate. Some places the food is so spicy-hot that you can't taste the flavour, all you get is the burn. HOWEVER, this dish was absolutely perfect. The chiles were HOT and made my eyes water, but the flavour was fantastic! I could taste the seasonings on the pork, and the tomatillos in the salsa perfectly, and my mouth was savouring all of the lovely tastes with just a bit of burn. Thank you, Josh & crew for such a tasty treat! The cinnamon rolls will have to wait for another visit...

data.title: Fantastic food and very nice staff...
data.text: I'm new to the area, from a much larger east coast foodie city.  After sampling many restaurants across Eugene since I've arrived, I've found truly fantastic food at Tres Mil.  The chef prepares fresh, made to order meals while you watch (or wait sipping delicious coffee in the ample seating area).  Bonus...If you have kids, plenty of booth space and the occasional train goes by to keep them busy watching out the large windows and enjoying the sights and sounds.  The guys here know how to cook and it's a pleasure to watch them in their craft.  I've consistently found the food fresh, cooked and seasoned expertly, and made with care.  The Huevos Rancheros are the best I've ever tasted.  Ranchero sauce is perfect.  The staff will strike up a conversation with you about the food and drinks and are very friendly.  Highly recommend.

data.title: "Most important meal of the day" worthy.
data.text: If you are going to drop $8+ on breakfast, give the "Most important meal of the day," the respect it deserves. Huevos rancheros! Ask for some chorizo to be added and you will have a powerhouse breakfast that will fuel your whole day without weighing you down. Fantastic bright flavors, rich warm comfort for those of us that miss an authentic huevos rancheros breakfast.

data.title: Hit and miss
data.text:
We came here a month ago and had a great breakfast. Came back Oct 21st and it was a big disappointment.

The first time I went I had the huevos verde with carnitas. It was delicious. I've dreamt about it since. Perfect amount of meat to sauce. The masa cake was nice and tender and the verde sauce was amazing. Second time I went my wife had it with chorizo and it wasn't even close to the same thing. The biggest let down on that part was that she got maybe 1 ounce of burnt chorizo.  The masa cake was burnt and hard to get through. The second time around I got the huevos diablos. It was ok. Not very flavorful though. The masa cake was burnt pretty bad too. Portions for both plates were smaller. The presentation of the dishes were a little lacking to compared to the first visit. 
There were two different chefs working on each visit and the first one (a bald gentlemen) seemed to be more passionate about his work. 
Overall I really like Tres Mil border cafe but I will be selective on when I go there. I would rate it a 5 if it were based off my first trip and a 1 if it were off of my second trip so a 3 it is. I will return, hopefully I can relive my first breakfast experience there.

data.title: Ms
data.text: My office is very close to the fifth Street market international cafés which is where Tres Mil is. I've lived in Eugene for many years. Tres Mil  is the best Mexican food around.  I love their huevos rancheros.

data.title: Nice  atmosphere (market food court.)
data.text: I just had lunch there today.  I wasn't very hungry so I had one carnitas taco with black beans on top.  For $3 it hit the spot and was perfect.  Sometime I'll try more of a "meal" rather than just one item a la carte (but it was perfect for today!)

data.title: Mexican Fusion
data.text: What a great place to have a casual Mexican fusion meal - and breakfast all day.  Very touristy location - 5th Street Shops in Eugene - in a sort of food court area.  The prices are reasonable - $8 for Huevos Rancheros.  They make their own sausage and try various and sundry techniques to produce a tasty meal with just the right blend of spice.  I have been three times and see it as a favorite.  Unfortunately, the food court closes at 6pm most nights so later dinners are out.

data.title: Best Enchilada I ever ate!!!
data.text:
It is unfortunate Tres Mil Border Café is located inside the 5th Street Market food court because this place deserves to be in a great location all on its own and open way past 7:00 p.m. Make the effort of going to this food court to eat at Tres Mil because you will be in for one of the most amazing meals in Eugene at a fantastic price. Their enchilada is the best I have ever had. I selected an enchilada with carnitas and the quality of the beef was excellent. The quality of all their ingredients is excellent. I also ate a cinnamon roll and this is also an experience you should not miss. This is nothing like a Cinnabon from the mall. It is incredible and not to be compared to that. You will find their food addictive. I am going back this weekend.

I was going to take a picture of the enchilada, but I was so anxious to eat it I was halfway done with it by the time I thought of it. Maybe this weekend I will get a picture.

data.title: A Gem never to be missed
data.text:
This place is located inside 5th Street Cafeteria.

I ordered the Slow Roasted pork with tormatillo salsa, sweet potato mash, jicama. This was one is for the books! So yummy for lack of a better word (I just finished almost licking my plate and I'm still in a lovely daze).

Despite being in a food court the service was stellar. They answered all questions I had and so made my choice easy and I'm glad I made the choice. I will DEFINITELY be coming here again...

data.title: Fantastic New Place
data.text: This new restaurant in the middle of the Fifth Street Market food court is a wonderful addition to the other eateries located there. We stopped for dinner the other night after a movie and what a treat! The prawns served with a crunchy black bean side (some sort of nuts, I guess) were delicious. The little attention to detail like the tiny banana chips and the little chunks of roasted pineapple brought the dish to the next level. The pork dinner served on a bed of mashed sweet potatoes was also delicious. The spicy sauce was almost too hot.....but as it was, it was just perfect. We definitely plan to return to this wonderful little gem and try their breakfast menu, which I understand is served all day. Welcome to Eugene, Tres Mil!!
